column4: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 3. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column4: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.
column8: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.

column2: 5. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column6: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column8: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column10: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.

column8: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column4: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column6: Always come to a complete stop
column8: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way

column4: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated
column6: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column8: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column10: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed

column2: 10. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
12. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.

column2: 13. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column6: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column8: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column10: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.

column4: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 15. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
16. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive with the flow of traffic.
column6: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column8: drive faster than the flow of traffic.

column2: 17. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column10: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 18. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column6: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column10: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 19. What should you do when another car is trying to pass you?
column4: After checking for oncoming traffic, adjust your speed to allow safe passing.
column6: yield the right-of-way to the other driver.
column10: pull off the road to allow safe passing.

column2: 20. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column6: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column10: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column6: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column10: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 22. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
23. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
